page.title: 09CHURCHES
page.content: In Porthleven, there are two Methodist Chapels called Fore Street and Peverell Road, the Parish Church of St Bartholomew, the Christadelphian Church and the Apostolic. The Methodist Chapels are the biggest churches in Porthleven. They each have an Anniversary to remember the founding of the Sunday Schools. Both Churches join St.Bartholomews to celebrate Saint Peterstide. St. Bartholomews Church was built in 1842 on land given by Canon John Rogers the squire of the nearby Penrose Estate. The Apostolic Church is small and so does not join in many of the village activities. Christadelphian means brother in Christ. This church does not have festivals at Christmas and Easter like the other churches.
